weather.description: Cool and occasionally rainy with crisp mountain air; snow is possible on the Sierra Nevada nearby.
Still cool with some rain, but days begin to lengthen and occasional sunny spells appear.
Mild spring conditions arrive with variable weather and blooming almond trees in the countryside.
Pleasant and green with warm afternoons, though showers remain common throughout the month.
Warm and increasingly sunny, making it one of the most enjoyable months to visit Granada.
Hot and dry with long sunny days; ideal for sightseeing if you start early to avoid midday heat.
Very hot and almost entirely dry; shade and hydration are essential during afternoon hours.
Intense heat continues with virtually no rainfall; mornings and evenings are the best times to explore.
Heat eases noticeably and conditions become more comfortable for walking and sightseeing.
Mild and autumnal with occasional rain returning; a pleasant and less crowded time to visit.
Cooler and wetter with shorter days; the city is quieter and the surrounding hills turn golden.
Cold and sometimes rainy with festive atmosphere in the city; snow dusts the Sierra Nevada peaks.
